data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the PowerPlan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Monitor core temperature continuously via esophageal or rectal probe and document q1h
On admission if weight unknown/estimated, then qdaily
Newborn Critical Congential Heart Disease (CCHD) Screening
Routine, once (between 24 to 48 hours OR prior to discharge)
q4h interval, per standard, goals 0 to 2

Refer to Neonatal Drug Manual and/or pharmacist for drug interval
Select [ampicillin AND (cefoTAXime OR gentamicin)] or [ampicillin AND cefoTAXime AND acyclovir]
For suspected meningitis, select ampicillin 100 mg/kg/dose and consider lumbar puncture

1 mg, IM, once, drug form: inj

Administer both Hepatitis B Immune Globulin (HBIG) and Hepatitis B Vaccine to newborn when mother is Hepatitis B Surface Antigen positive OR at high risk and status is negative or unknown
Administer Hepatitis B Vaccine to newborn if primary care-giver or household contact is known to have chronic hepatitis B infection
